body_html: The most straightforward fix is simply to use grad_output.data.mul, but since I don't have any experience with the kind of gradient-of-a-gradient methods that are the impetus behind the type change, I don't know which references you can or can't switch to .data.
body_text: The most straightforward fix is simply to use grad_output.data.mul, but since I don't have any experience with the kind of gradient-of-a-gradient methods that are the impetus behind the type change, I don't know which references you can or can't switch to .data.
body: The most straightforward fix is simply to use `grad_output.data.mul`, but since I don't have any experience with the kind of gradient-of-a-gradient methods that are the impetus behind the type change, I don't know which references you can or can't switch to `.data`.
